meanings.sent1: She beefed about the long line at the store.
meanings.sent2: He always beefed when it was time to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to beef about the lack of treats in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The students beefed like a choir of discontent.
meanings.sent5: Her constant beefing made everyone tired of listening.

meanings.definition: To add strength or substance to something
meanings.sent1: He beefed up his essay with more examples.
meanings.sent2: The chef beefed the soup with extra vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The superhero beefed up his powers to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent4: The artist beefed the painting with bold colors.
meanings.sent5: The team beefed their defense to win the game.

meanings.sent1: The storm beefed up as the night went on.
meanings.sent2: She beefed the spiciness of the curry with extra chili.
meanings.sent3: The excitement beefed up when the surprise guest arrived.
meanings.sent4: His determination beefed the success of his project.
meanings.sent5: The music beefed the emotions of the scene in the movie.
